page.title: 04 THE LEIGH 2
page.content: The village used to be much larger but at the beginning of the century the river navigation was improved with a new weir downstream at Maisemore which raised the river level by about 6 feet. This apparently made the flooding worse in the fields between the village and the River Severn so that some cottages and farm buildings were abandoned and the farmers changed their land use probably employing fewer workers. {SCHOOLS There were 2 schools in the village. A Free School for Non-Conformist children opened in 1859 and a Church of England National School in 1862. The last one closed in 1968. The school meals used to be brought by van from Gloucester in metal containers.
